title: Casualty spoilers: Archie’s career at risk as vile Vincent Millbank returns
text:
Archie’s worried (Picture: BBC)

There are worrying times ahead for Archie (Genesis Lynea) in tonight’s Casualty as nasty Vincent Millbank (Tim Woodward) returns after having an accident. Last time he was in the ED someone threw acid over his car, so he’s understandably reluctant to come to Holby. He’s convinced he’s still in danger and someone is out to get him.

Of course we know that it was Archie who threw the acid, so despite Will (Jack Nolan)’s efforts to get rid of any CCTV evidence she can’t help worrying. If Millbank works out it was her who attacked his car, her career could be over. As Millbank becomes increasingly paranoid, is Archie about to get into serious trouble?

Meanwhile, Ethan (George Rainsford) gets a visit from Effie’s dad Theo (Jim Sturgeon). After previously warning Ethan to stay away from his daughter, Theo now wants his help to find out whether Effie is in the trial group that gets the experimental treatment, or the placebo group. Ethan knows it would be incredibly unethical to do as Theo asks – but his old friend is desperate enough to try a spot of blackmail, reminding Ethan that he hasn’t been entirely professional in his dealings with Effie so far. How will Ethan react?

Advertisement

Advertisement

And Rash (Neet Mohan) is angry that Mason (Victor Oshin) hasn’t talked to Ethan about the D-dimer mistake he made recently. There’s even worse to come when he uncovers other mistakes Mason has let Rash take the blame for. Once again the two of them have to work together on a case. Is this Mason’s opportunity to make amends for his behaviour, or will Mason go to even greater lengths to cover his tracks?

Sue Haasler is the author of five novels and the official BBC Holby City book, which you can read about here.
